TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
53 Apostolorum Philippi et Iacobi.
SEint phelipe and seint Iacob : Apostles weren twei&yogh;e:
Þe formeste dai þat comez in may : deth huy þoleden bei&yogh;e.
Aftur ore louerdes passione : in þe twentiþe &yogh;ere
Seint phelipe prechede in Sythie : to men þat luþere weren.
Þis men nomen seint phelipe : and to heore Maumates[al. maumet] him ladde.
And sone so he bi-foren hem cam : þis maumates loude gradde;
Fuyr huy bleuwen out of heore Mouþes : þat þare-with huy brou&yogh;ten of dawe
Þe princes sone of þe lond : and tweie constables of þe lawe;
And manie men þat þare-nei&yogh; weren : wel grete siknesse to heom nome,
Some fullen in-to þe dropesie : and some meoseles bi-come.
Muche reuþe was into al þat lond : of þis misauenture.
"Wulle &yogh;e," seide seint phelip þo : "mi conseil alle i-huyre,
And ichulle þoru&yogh; godes grace : helen eov euer[e]ch-on."
Glad was þis folk of þat word : and graunteden him a-non.
"berez awei," he seide, "þis foule wi&yogh;t : þat &yogh;e habbez to i-bede,
And nimez þe fourme of þe holie croiz : and settez in his stude!"
Þat folk was fayn of his bi-heste : i-redie þare weren i-nowe,
Ane rode huy setten up on hei&yogh; : þe maumates huy al-to-drowe.
Seint pheolip þoru&yogh; godes grace : drof out bi-fore heore ei&yogh;e
A foul deouel of þat on : þat huy alle i-sei&yogh;e.
Þo þis rode was up i-set : and þe Maumet i-brou&yogh;t to grounde,
Alle þe sike men þat þare-nei&yogh; weren : bi-comen hole and sounde,
And þe þreo men þat weren a-slawe : a-&yogh;ein to liue come—
Muche was þe Ioye into al þat lond : þat men þare-of nome.
Cristinedom huy guonne a-fongue : and Anouri þe swete rode,
And bi-lieueden on him þat bou&yogh;te us alle : þare-on with is blode.
Þoru&yogh; þe vertuwe of þis faire miracle : muche folk of þe londe
bi-gan cristine for-to beo : and þe ri&yogh;te bi-leue onder-stonde;
After þe wissingue of seint phelip : alle heore lijf huy guonne lede—
For prophesie and ri&yogh;t-w[i]snesse : huy heolden al þat he seide.
Þo phelipe was sixti &yogh;er : and seouene and twenti old,
In pays he deide in his bed : ase þe bok us hath i-told.
Gret deol þat folk made þo : and wel faire huy him nome
And bureden him with gret honour : ase a swuch man to bi-come.
